chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: nat -> R

Goal:
ex_series a -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l}

Premises:
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) => exists l : V, is_series a l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Inductive N : Set := N0 : N | Npos : positive -> N For Npos: Argument scope is [positive_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
Rseries_CV_comp : forall An Bn : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 <= An n <= Bn n) -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 Bn N) l} -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
cv_cauchy_1 : forall An : nat -> R, {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l} -> Cauchy_crit_series An
cv_cauchy_2 : forall An : nat -> R, Cauchy_crit_series An -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
alternated_series : forall Un : nat -> R, Un_decreasing Un -> Un_cv Un 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (tg_alt Un) N) l}
CV_ALT : forall Un : nat -> R, Un_decreasing Un -> positivity_seq Un -> Un_cv Un 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (tg_alt Un) N) l}
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
ps_atan_exists_01 : forall x : R, 0 <= x <= 1 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (tg_alt (Ratan_seq x)) N) l}
ps_atan_exists_1 : forall x : R, -1 <= x <= 1 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (tg_alt (Ratan_seq x)) N) l}
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
exist_PI = alternated_series PI_tg PI_tg_decreasing PI_tg_cv : {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (tg_alt PI_tg) N) l}
Series_correct : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> is_series a (Series a)
sum_n_Reals : forall (a : nat -> R_AbelianGroup) (N : nat), sum_n a N = sum_f_R0 a N
ex_series_dec : forall a : nat -> R, {ex_series a} + {~ ex_series a}
Cauchy_crit_series = fun An : nat -> R => Cauchy_crit (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
CVN_r = fun (fn : nat -> R -> R) (r : posreal) => {An : nat -> R & {l : R | Un_cv (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => Rabs (An k)) n) l /\ (forall (n : nat) (y : R), Boule 0 r y -> Rabs (fn n y) <= An n)}} : (nat -> R -> R) -> posreal -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
tech12 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x l : R), Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => An i * x ^ i) N) l -> Pser An x l
Series = fun a : nat -> R => real (Lim_seq (sum_n a)) : (nat -> R) -> R Argument scope is [function_scope]
Rcomplete.R_complete : forall Un : nat -> R, Cauchy_crit Un -> {l : R | Un_cv Un l}
growing_cv : forall Un : nat -> R, Un_growing Un -> has_ub Un -> {l : R | Un_cv Un l}
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
Cesaro : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (l : R), Un_cv Bn l -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> cv_infty (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => An k * Bn k) n / sum_f_R0 An n) l
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]

```coq
intros a Ha.
apply Series_correct.
exact Ha.
Qed.```

original: intros a Ha. apply Series_correct. apply Ha.
